sentences.en: a fractional decline in earnings
sentences.cn: 利润微降

sentences.en: After the war, the city declined in importance.
sentences.cn: 战后这座城市的重要性下降了。

sentences.en: Car sales have declined by a quarter.
sentences.cn: 汽车销量下滑了四分之一。

sentences.en: He fell into a decline.
sentences.cn: 他的影响逐渐减弱.

sentences.en: Her health has been declining progressively for several months.
sentences.cn: 几个月来她的健康状况不断恶化。

sentences.en: Hourly output by workers declined 1.3% in the first quarter.
sentences.cn: 工人每小时的产量在第1季度下降了1.3%。

sentences.en: I appreciate your kindness but must decline the offer.
sentences.cn: 雅意心领!

sentences.en: I must decline to show favour to any of the candidates.
sentences.cn: 我必须拒绝偏袒任何一位候选人.

sentences.en: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.cn: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.en: Meryl's health started a precipitous decline.
sentences.cn: 梅里尔的健康状况开始急剧下降。

sentences.en: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.cn: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.en: Official figures show a sharp decline in the number of foreign tourists.
sentences.cn: 官方数字显示外国游客数量骤降。

sentences.en: Prices at the fairs are stable with a slight decline.
sentences.cn: 价格稳中有降.

sentences.en: Spending on information technology has declined.
sentences.cn: 用于信息技术的支出减少了。

sentences.en: Thankfully the smoking of cigarettes is on the decline.
sentences.cn: 令人欣慰的是，吸烟量在逐渐下降。

sentences.en: The closure of the mine was the single most important factor in the town's decline.
sentences.cn: 矿山的关闭是这个镇衰落的唯一最重要的因素。

sentences.en: The customs figures show a steady decline in British trade.
sentences.cn: 关税数字表明英国的贸易一直在走下坡路.

sentences.en: The decline in marriage has been offset by a rise in cohabitation.
sentences.cn: 结婚人数的减少由于同居人数的增加而得以弥补。

sentences.en: the economic decline faced by many cities
sentences.cn: 许多城市面临的经济衰退

sentences.en: The first signs of economic decline became visible.
sentences.cn: 经济衰退的最初迹象开始显现出来。

sentences.en: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.cn: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

sentences.en: The number of staff has declined from 217,000 to 114,000.
sentences.cn: 员工人数已从217000人减少到114000人。

sentences.en: There has been a decline in the size of families.
sentences.cn: 家庭的规模已有缩小。

sentences.en: There has been a sharp decline in profits this year.
sentences.cn: 今年的利润大幅度下降.

sentences.en: This year can only see a repeat performance of the decline.
sentences.cn: 今年还会出现下降。

sentences.en: To decline to vote is a cop-out.
sentences.cn: 拒绝投票就是一种逃避。

sentences.en: We managed to decline gracefully.
sentences.cn: 我们设法婉拒了。

trans.tran_en: If there is a decline in something, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or quality
If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength

trans.tran_cn: 减少，衰落，下降，衰退，婉拒，（单词）变格
trans.tran_en: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something
If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength
to decrease in quantity or importance
to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something
